definition: to protect/to defend/to guard against/to prevent

sentences.english: All of a sudden, they lost their balance and fell in.
sentences.chinese: 冷不防，他们失去了平衡掉进了枯井。

sentences.english: One day, as she was scolding me, I suddenly threw a question at her.
sentences.chinese: 一天，她训斥我时，我冷不防向她提了个问题。

sentences.english: They popped a question at me.
sentences.chinese: 他们冷不防向我提了一个成绩。

sentences.english: I can't forgive myself for having been taken by surprise.
sentences.chinese: 我不能原谅自己被打了个冷不防。

sentences.english: Then, without warning, she suddenly lifted up the pie and pushed it into her own face.
sentences.chinese: 接着她冷不防突然举起那个馅饼，扣到她自己的脸上。

sentences.english: Suddenly a pair of eyes met garrie's in recognition .
sentences.chinese: 冷不防有一双熟识的眼睛和盖莉对视了一下。

sentences.english: Suddenly a pair of eyes met Garrie's in recognition.
sentences.chinese: 冷不防有一双熟识的眼睛和她对视了一下。

sentences.english: The judge surprised the facts from the witness.
sentences.chinese: 法官来了个冷不防，迫使证人吐露了真情。

sentences.english: The court surprised a confession out of the defendant.
sentences.chinese: 法庭冷不防使被告招了供。

sentences.english: Suddenly, the plane fits much better.
sentences.chinese: 冷不防地，平面就会变得更加合适了。

definition: to be just about to/to be on the point of
(idiom) no sooner said than done/before you know it
pinyin: shuo1 shi2 chi2 , na4 shi2 kuai4

definition: the very moment/just then/during (that brief interval)
to stagger/to stumble/to reel/Taiwan pr. [lie4 ju1]
